page.title: 19INTERVIEW WITH MRS L.LEESE
page.content: Mrs.Leese is a local resident who is aged 85."In 1930s there was a depression prior to World War 2.I worked in the Leek Silk Mill.I left home at 6.00am for the train to Stoke and on another train to Leek(returning at 7.00pm.)I got 2 guineas per week(6 days per week.)Village life focussed on the church.Sunday consisted of going to the Church of England which was very primitive but enjoyable.Also we had a girls' club and on Mayday we platted a Maypole on the Vicarage lawn.There were 2 pubs,The Dusty Miller and The Wind- mill,and a shop where Deryn's Hair- dressers is now.I had 4 brothers and 4 sisters-Luther,Lewis,Leonard and Lemual.My sisters were called Levison, Lavinia,Lillian and Ledicia.By 1939 the airfield was a training centre.I also worked on a farm where we started 6.30 am.and worked until 9.30pm.at Harvest."
